title: AB InBev shares plunge as drinkers down less beer
text:
Shares in AB InBev plunged after the world’s biggest brewer cut its forecast for profit growth this year.

The Belgian company, whose brands include Budweiser, Corona and Stella Artois, said beer volume fell 0.9% in the three months to September, although revenues rose 2.7pc to $13.2bn (£10.3bn).

That was weaker than analysts had expected and reflected drinkers in South Korea and Brazil shunning its products following price increases. Demand was also muted in the bigger US and Chinese markets.

The brewer described the quarter as "challenging" on Friday and said it now expected “moderate” rather than "strong" profit increases.
